result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald A Goebel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $250 fine plus costs. If fine and costs are not paid in full prior to 5/2/15, stay on jail time will be lifted.

Stayed. If Defendant pays fine and costs in full on or before 5/2/15, stay will be permanent. If Defendant fails to pay fine and costs in full on or before 5/2/15, stay will be lifted. Good time and Huber privileges granted. 60 days from sentencing date to report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald A Goebel

defendant.name: Goebel, Gerald A
defendant.address: 819 Mount Mary Drive, Green Bay, WI 54311

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gerald A Goebel in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Gerald A Goebel in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense requests plea/sentencing in 30 days, has one issue to work out with ADA Korb. State has no objection.  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Gerald A Goebel in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant lost his job as a result of these charges, is looking for work, requests continuance to February to allow Defendant to file taxes and get some money. State has no objection. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Gerald A Goebel in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty plea. Defense advises that offer has been received, requests hearing near Christmas to allow Defendant time to get money together.  Status conference scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases

Defendant Gerald A Goebel in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Gerald A Goebel in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Court questions Defendant on progress getting an attorney. Defendant advises that he has reinstated his license, but company he works for is investigating whether he was driving after suspension, has not worked since September 1, can't afford an attorney. Court advises Defendant to speak with PD, advises of Petition for Court-appointed Counsel if he does not qualify for PD. Defendant returns with Atty Gerbers, qualifies for PD.  Arraignment scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Gerald A Goebel appears by video conference.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant was fingerprinted 9/01/14 by jail staff.
